page.title: 01ETTRICK VALLEY INTRODUCTION.
page.content: The centre of Ettrick Valley has high hills on each side of the winding river.The hills on the North side are rocky and not good for grazing but on the South side they have good ground and coniferous woods. The river runs East down the valley and the road runs alongside.The water comes from the hills in burns then into the river.At the point where the Tima Valley joins,the hills become wider apart and wild,deciduous trees grow naturally in the bogs. On either side of the river Tima a tributary to the river Ettrick there are coniferous trees used for timber. In the forests there is a lot of wildlife.Birds come from different lands for the summer. Most of the buildings are for community uses.30% of the population of the whole valley live here.
